column1: She could taste blood now on her lips where her own teeth had bitten them, could see blood flecking her vision, hear it pounding in her ears as she ran, propelled by the first hot rush of her panic so that when she collided with the rough corner of a market stall she did not feel it ; when she stumbled again and scrambled to her feet she was unaware of her grazed hands and knees ; heedless of brewers ' drays, the hooves of heavy horses ; the outrage of the passers - by she pushed aside ; the woman with the heavy market basket she knocked over.
